Title: Nigeria@65: Leaders call for reforms on poverty, insecurity, faltering democracy
Summary: Nigeria@65: Leaders call for reforms on poverty, insecurity, faltering democracy . Nigeria's leaders, opposition figures, clerics, and governance experts have delivered a sobering verdict on the state of the nation . They warn of worsening poverty and insecurity, weak institutions, and declining democratic standards .

Title: Probe plot to fleece Osun LGs of N12.75b, PDP tells IGP, EFCC
Summary: Osun State chapter of the PDP has called on the Inspector-General of Police (IGP) and the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) to probe the alleged attempt by the court-sacked All Progressives Congress (APC) chairmen in the state to illegally pay almost N13 billion of the local council

Title: Dangote’s rift with PENGASSAN unfortunate, says MAN
Summary: Director-General, Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN), Segun Ajayi-Kadir, has described the rift between Dangote Refinery and PENGASSAN as unfortunate, says MAN . The rift is said to be a needless attack on private enterprise .

Title: Tinubu, Ododo mourn as victims of Kogi boat mishap rise to 26
Summary: Kogi Governor, Ahmed Usman Ododo, paid a condolence visit to the Ejeh of Ibaji and Chairman of the Ibaji Area Traditional Council, at his residence over the loss in a boat mishap .

Title: Akpabio hints at fresh wave of opposition defections to APC
Summary: Senate President Godswill Akpabio has declared that more governors from opposition parties are on the verge of crossing over to the All Progressives Congress (APC) President Bola Tinubu’s reforms .

Title: WEAK BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE: Nigeria risks losing out in digital trade, economy
Summary: The World Trade Organisation, WTO, and the World Bank, WB, have warned that Nigeria’s weak infrastructure and regulatory gaps could prevent the country from unlocking the potential of the billion dollar digital economy .

Title: Why Nigerian businesses must embrace data as asset — Lagos D-Gov
Summary: Obafemi Hamzat has advised Nigerian businesses to embrace data as an asset and the new oil . He said unlike oil, data value grows, the more you refine it . The Deputy Governor of Lagos State said data value grew the more refined it gets .

Title: Stock market investors earn N1.8trn in September amid CBN’s reforms
Summary: Investors in the stock market earned N1.811 trillion in September 2025 . Central Bank of Nigeria, CBN’s monetary reforms have led to increased investors’ confidence in the market . Analysts emphasised that the recent reduction in the CBN's Monetary Policy Rate, MPR, to 27% from 27.5

Title: NIIRA will foster economic growth  – Experts
Summary: The Nigeria Insurance Industry Reform Act, NIIRA 2025, will foster economic growth . The Commissioner for Insurance, Mr. Olusegun Omosehin said this at the Insurance Meets Tech (IMT) 4.0 Conference in Lagos, themed “Innovating for the New Trybe”
